item.title: 04 Chapter Four - Interlude One
item.description: There are many different directions I could take you at this point. I want you to stop and think about that for just a moment. In any novel the author can decide to take you on many different paths. It feels, for you the reader, like there was only one way that story could have gone. The book you read is exactly how things happened, but they never happened so there's no reason they couldn't have happened in a different way. You have no idea how many decisions the author made, how many times they changed a scene, how different the first draft may have been. The sign of a good story, a good author, is that you feel like the fictional characters are real, that you are reading the story of an actual event. As I keep breaking the fourth wall, I am obviously not that author. I just want you to understand how this story is a bit like the theory of the multiverse. There are so many discarded realities that I could go with at what I have decided is now the beginning of the story.I could tell you that I went back to my hometown, fell in love with a simple, common man and realized that I didn't need all the glitz and glamor of a minor celebrity adjacent existence. I actually wrote this story once before and it sucked like a made for TV romcom. So, that's not our reality.I could tell you that it was here I learned that I was a "child of air." Someone who when presented with a special stone from my spiritual guide could travel through the multiverse trying to find the right path to make the world a better place. That my brother traveled with me (we were named Shelley and Byron in that story because of my love of the romantics) and there were others like us who just tried to find the right solution to the world's problems. In the end we would learn that it was art and creativity. Art and creativity that actually brought about lasting societal change. This is another novel I started once and abandoned. It's really somewhat cliche, so that's not our reality either.I could tell you that it was here that a bomb was dropped. That much of the world's water was poisoned and we were thrown into nuclear winter. That my ex-husband, children, and brother died of the radiation, and I went slowly mad with grief. Until I stumbled upon a small community forming a resistance to the government who had risen up in the aftermath of the bombs. A small community making change through, you guessed it, art and creativity. I found my sanity and we saved the world through art. This is a story I was going to tell through poetry, like a concept album. But, really, it's just another cliche isn't it? No, that's not our reality.I bet you are growing as frustrated with this as I am. Learning that every idea is just a recycling of an old idea. Every story is based on a cliche. Why even bother to read anymore when you've read every story out there twenty times already, just slightly altered in form and setting?Because that's our fate. As readers and writers it is our fate to take a story told again and again and somehow make it our own as it's recycled through the machine of our own experience and knowledge base. We could both read the same book and see it in entirely different ways. That's why my jobs as a book reviewer were bullshit. I would write a pan of a book and yet someone else out there may have found themselves in that story. Or maybe it was just a story that the author needed to tell. Reviews have their place, but they also get in the way of people finding their true loves.So, here we are. All the old ideas laid out and cast aside. They are not our universe, our reality. They are graves in the cemetery of ideas. Let them rest. Let them lie. Let's be bold and forge ahead. I could have told you this story from my twenties. I could have expanded on my marriage and my life as a mom. I could have told this very story from any place we have already been. But it wasn't what this story wanted to be. This story wanted a new hero. It didn't want a fresh faced twenty year old. It didn't want a struggling new mother or a woman on the cusp of forty.This story wants to break at least one cliche. Allow a fifty year old woman a new beginning. So, let me tell you where I went from there.

item.title: 03 Chapter Three
item.description: The first time I saw my dad after 20 years, I couldn't help but think that he looked small and old and not like someone who had ever been on talk shows or who had multiple women in multiple towns. There was something of aging rock star about him, but in a sad, one hit wonder kind of way. The ones who never change their hairstyles and cling to the hits their fans came to hear. They're frozen in time. That was my dad and it broke my heart.He came to my apartment with a teddy bear under one arm and a bottle of wine under the other. An unpublished manuscript and a check for $5000 tucked under the first page. After coming in and setting everything down, he gave me the first hug I had gotten from my dad since I could only reach around his waist and beg him not to leave. To take me with him wherever he was going. He told me the teddy bear was for that little girl, the wine was for the woman I had become without him, the check was for all the payments he had missed, and not to worry about the manuscript for now. It was just something he thought I might like to read. If I had the time.We ate pasta, drank wine, and he asked about Dave and my mom. He told me about the drug problem he had developed in the 80s and how he'd been sober for the last year. He told me all of his money had gone to drugs and ex-wives. He told me that he had wanted to connect with me over the years, but he wanted to wait until he had another hit novel, a caring wife, and no cocaine up his nose. He decided to go for 1/3 because he was doing that thing where addicts try to right their wrongs. He hoped that didn't sound like that's the only reason he wanted to see me, but he did hope he could gain my forgiveness and maybe I could read his manuscript. See if it was something I could write up for the magazine. Get the word of mouth going. I was too desperate for him to love me to realize there wasn't much in this for me.I wasn't sure what I would have done with a situation where there was something in it for me. So I read his manuscript, told him it was great, kept plugging away at my terrible novel, fought traffic into the city, and drank too much with smelly bands in hole in the wall nightclubs. And never thought that it was the stuff of novels.About six months into this whole adventure, with my dad asking me for some of that $5000 back, Dave asking me to just come back to Chicago, my boss asking me to rewrite the articles of other writers, and my body asking for a break from too many late nights, I met a man. I hate that so much of this story takes place around my desperate need for a man in my life, but I have to tell it like it happened. Well, like it didn't happen since this is fiction, but like it would have happened if it had happened at all. I could try to slip realities, but really, they all turn out the same in the end.I was taking a break from bars and shopping for crab and chocolate at Pike Place Market when I noticed a film crew across the street at the pier. I wandered over to watch with the crowd on the sidelines. The guy next to me told me how he had been an extra the day before and he was hoping to get put into another scene. He had good cheekbones, so I assumed it was a good bet. We watched together for awhile until the crew started packing up and he asked me if I wanted to get coffee. That single coffee lead to a marriage proposal four months later. A wedding attended by my dad, my mom, Dave, his mom, and my new husband's very large extended family. I asked my dad to walk me down the aisle, most certainly offending Dave who had been there for me my whole life. But, he never said it out loud. It was just another silent burden I carried on my hips like toddlers. Eventually I also carried toddlers on my hips. I drove a mini-van, I went to soccer practice. I had no idea what bands were new, what books were just released, or what movies were at the theater, unless they were animated. My husband kept trying to get acting gigs and finally got a role in a TV show. He was gone for weeks at a time and I was bathing kids and trying to remember fractions. I still wrote articles, sent them off to be rejected, but mostly I cried at old romantic comedies on cable, and ate dessert alone after the kids were in bed.I know what you're doing now. You're rolling your eyes and telling me how cliche this whole story is. You're begging me for something other than a "girl has big dreams, girl gets married, girl becomes mom, girl forgets who she is" story. You're begging me for anything other than the rambling shit you've read so far. "Tell me why I should care!" you're screaming and slamming the book shut in a huff of anger. And I don't blame you. I don't know why you should care about a life where things went as things went and no one was happy in the end. Why should you keep reading? Maybe because you hope it will all get better. You hope it will all work out for the quiet fat girl who never knew love. Oh, that's a cliche too? Well, fuck you! Stop reading! See if I care.Except I do care. Too much. Which is why I kept trying to make a perfect home for a man who was slowly moving away from me. And once again I was too desperate for someone to love me to realize there wasn't much in it for me. That's why I hope you'll keep reading. Let me show you what's in it for you. We made it work for twenty-two years. Until our kids were in college, one after another, just like Dave and me. Dave, who had kids and a job of his own. There was still a continent between us and I missed him. When my husband got another role in another show, when he told me about all of the other women, when he made this novel even more cliche by being a cheating bastard, I left. I walked away and apologized to my kids, who only asked me what had taken so long for me to leave a man they barely knew. Just another absent father. I moved back to Chicago. And that, THAT is where this story will actually start. At fifty years old, and still a minor celebrity adjacent insignificant fat girl (woman?).

item.title: 02 Chapter Two
item.description: So far everything I've told you is reality. Not the shifting reality of falling asleep or staring out the window at nothing, but the real story. I can even tell you that the lead singer who put his hands between my legs and asked if it was ok was named Jay. And he had amazing hair and applied his eyeliner with more care than I did my own. I can tell you that college sucked for me because I reverted to the quiet writer who lingered in the library drinking coffee at midnight and reading Virginia Woolf because I thought that's what I should be doing. I had followed Dave's lead from one thing to another and had never really chosen an identity of my own. Was I writing to gain Daddy's love? Or to feel that feeling of the way words wound around my throat and erupted in raw emotion like they had on stage? I didn't know because I never asked. I was the shadow of my older brother, I was a ghost, a personality thin enough to see through even if my body had worn a size XL school girl skirt with my fishnets.Dave graduated and started working for a record company as an unpaid intern, which meant he was also working as a cashier at a grocery store to pay the bills. School and life pulled us apart and for the first time I was rudderless, unmoored without my big brother to guide and protect me. I graduated a year later and got a job offer to write for a pop culture website. The internet was still relatively new and the opportunity was too good to pass up, even if the job was in Milwaukee. Further away from everything that grounded me, I set up a home in a tiny apartment just outside of the city and took the bus to an even tinier office everyday. The other women working at the website were beauty experts or die hard fans of the popular bands that they played on the "adult" listening stations. Not one of them had ever heard of Henry Rollins or The Misfits. Not one of them had ever been a misfit. Not one of them had ever pulled their stockings down to let a boy who's leather jacket smelled like beer and sweat inside them in a tiny backroom while a cover of "Ball and Chain" blasted outside the door. And not one of them would have believed that I had done that very thing. The fat girl who handled the section of the website that focused on best selling books. Mostly self help and romances - you can see the demographic.You've probably noticed that I brought up this tryst with Jay three times already in just the first chapter and a half. That's mostly because it was all the sex I had for many years after. It wasn't just that one time either. There was an actual hotel room in Madison where we slept wrapped around each other after. Where I woke up to green eyes staring into mine and his hand on my hip. Soon to be on my knees taking him into my mouth while he moaned my name and I believed in love songs all over again. But since then, I had just been the quiet college literature student who flew under the radar and didn't invite either scorn or interest from anyone. Three things happened in perfect synchronicity around this time. I started writing a novel, I got a job at a proper magazine (as a book reviewer, I seemed to have accidentally fallen into a niche career), and my dad reached out to both Dave and me. He was washed up. His most recent wife had left him and he was feeling the years. Dave flat out refused to see him and encouraged me to return the letters unopened. For the first time in our lives, Dave and I were on opposite ends of a situation. My instinct was to listen to my big brother who had always protected me, but I also had a big empty hole where my dad would fit perfectly. As serendipity would have it, my dad was in Seattle and that's where the magazine was headquartered. Plus, my novel needed a setting, why not the Pacific Northwest?This is where you think the story starts. This is where you're thinking that the backstory is finally over and we can get on with whatever the fuck this book is supposed to be about. I wish it were that simple. I wish I could tell you that yes, this is where the story really gets going. Where I got in touch with my dad, love my job and Seattle and I lived happily ever after. Well, that wouldn't make much of a novel, now would it?No. Things kind of went of the rails in a place known for rain and the birth of Nirvana. I had resisted grunge for a long time after it killed off my beloved punk, but I had come around by the time I found myself in Seattle. By now Kurt was dead and there was something post grunge about the whole scene, but that didn't stop me from immersing myself in the music scene. Maybe throwing on a hippie dress and leaving it on the floor of some drummer's apartment overnight. I found that drummers had the best rhythm when it came to tongues on certain body parts. it was the drummers that would have me rocking my hips and begging for more. But, none of it went anywhere. And neither did the novel.I was trying to write in between club nights, book reviews, and raindrops and there wasn't enough coffee in Seattle to power that. The story was about a popular girl who found out her group of friends were all aliens underneath perfect faces and hair. My plan for the ending was that the girl was an alien too, but it was just as awful as it sounds. I would write and rewrite, but there was no saving what was a horrible idea from the beginning. I was writing amazing book reviews for the magazine, maybe I should have made note of what worked in the novels I loved most.But, you're waiting to hear about my reunion with my dad. You don't care about awful novels and drummers with shoulder tattoos and amazing tongues. The story doesn't really start there either, but at least it went better than my novel.

item.title: 01 Chapter One
item.description: This won't be anything. This won't wow you or keep you up at night or even be something you'll tell a friend about later. It's just a beginning. It's just a scene that will lead nowhere except to a place in your heart where you store your longing. A place that writes vignettes of another reality. That's all this is. A vignette of another reality that you write at night right before you fall asleep, the kind you won't even remember in the morning.This is what I tell myself when I sit down to write, so the pressure isn't too much. So that I can just pour out a story and not worry if anyone will care. It's just a nothing thing. An everyday thing. Which is how a lot of really meaningful things start. At least that's what I tell myself to convince myself it's not all a waste of time.But it's really all a waste of time, right? You live, you die, and the time in between will never really matter. Some would say it might matter a little more to those who actually change the times they're living in. Some would say that good people like Martin Luther King Jr and bad people like Hitler had changed the times they were living in and so maybe their time wasn't wasted. I say maybe Hitler needed a good hobby to distract him. And that MLK would be disappointed by how little has actually changed.Now I'm not just wasting time, but words since I haven't even begun to tell you a story. A story you could call mine, but I can't prove that any of it really happened this way, or that it really happened at all. Sometimes those other realities blur and I can't tell one from another.In this reality, I'm a writer. I already told you that. A writer with zero faith in her writing, which is probably why no one has ever read it. Actually, the members of my writing group have read me. And a few people I know online who write. But to the world at large I am insignificant, as I'm guessing you are as well. We are destined to die in obscurity. Which can either be freeing or depressing depending on your outlook. I choose to see it as freeing, as I have seen first hand the double edged sword of fame. My father wrote a bestseller and became something of a household name in the 1980s when people still read hardcovers and authors would appear on talk shows. It helped that he looked like a rock star and had never married my mother. The women swooned for his long hair and novels of life on tour as a roadie. Something he liked to tell people he had actually done.That's what I mean about the blurring of realities. At one time I thought my father was lying to sell more books, until I realized some part of him had come to believe that he had actually carried tour gear for Kiss in the 70s. And that he had slept with Paul Stanley's discarded groupies. If you ever read one of his novels, remember they're fiction. The only tour my father ever took was a book tour and the only thing he ever carried was the weight of a dream so heavy he had to set it down someplace. It fit perfectly on 8x11 typewriter paper, and even better in between two covers.I won't lie. I inherited his penchant for fabrication. His belief in the realities that only existed in his mind. I came to believe I was something special by association. That I had lived those book tours and waited behind the curtains at talk shows for my father to introduce the world to his daughter.In reality I was at home with my mother, reading about girls who fit in and had boyfriends named Kevin who saved them from some supernatural bad guy.Listening to my mother on the phone with another woman in another state who had just learned that my father had a daughter. Did my mother know that my father also had a son about a year older than me? Her face said she didn't, but she used her polite stranger voice and set up a meeting with the woman and my half brother. My life would never be the same.My brother Dave was everything I wasn't. Confident, loud, bratty, and hilarious. He couldn't care less that our dad only visited him twice a year, while I constantly sent my dad the short stories I wrote in hopes he would see that I was just like him. Our moms hit it off instantly and decided that Dave and I should be raised together so we would feel more like we had a family, so they bought a duplex in Illinois, halfway between their hometowns, and raised us together. What we were lacking in a father, we more than made up for in mothers.I bet you're wondering what the hell any of this has to do with anything and why the hell you should care. As we already established, I'm insignificant. I'm the child of a minor celebrity who no one even remembers as the author of a few novels that can quite often be found stuffed behind the Harlequin romances in used bookstores. I haven't given you a reason to care about this backstory. You don't even know my name or why you should waste your time turning the next page. But, let me ask you something. Isn't that the way you go into every novel? Not really knowing why you should care? And yes, I probably should have found a clever way to work this backstory into the main action - show, don't tell and all of that good advice, but I feel like you need to know where I've been to really care about where I am. Your time is precious so wouldn't you rather I just spend a few paragraphs getting you caught up? Don't you sometimes secretly wish an author would just get on with it and tell you what you need to know? I promise, neither one of us will believe where this ends up.Dave and I were inseparable once we became aware that the other existed. Dave was my playmate, my co-conspirator, my confidante, and eventually my protector. I was quiet, naive, and still seeking my father's love and Dave was constantly pulling me back from situations where I was ready to give myself too soon to feel special. In high school he relished the role of misfit while I dreamt of being popular like the girls in my teen romances. That is, until Dave discovered punk rock and dragged me along with him into the mosh pit. Literally and figuratively. Here were misfits who fit. Here were girls who would rather die than be one of the popular kids. Here was a bass line and a three chord progression that slid into my cochlea and threw itself around the inside of my ear. Here was something that made me feel alive. And made me want to tell my dad to fuck off, since telling your parents to fuck off was now cool. Our poor mothers.Where I was content to listen and let the anger wash over me, Dave wanted to create the rage. He wanted to be the one slamming his way into the safety pinned ears of the punks. And he wanted me to join him. He bought a drum set, he befriended a couple of punks at school who could play the requisite three chords, and we were a band. Although I wasn't quite sure what my role in the whole thing was. I had written a few songs because they weren't that different from the angsty poetry all teenagers write between the ages of 13 and 17. I liked the way the music wrapped around my words and animated them. Made them stand up in 3D and declare their existence. Dave decided I should sing because, really, it was better to not be able to sing in a punk band anyway. We called ourselves Yeah Nadia, because why not?That's how I ended up losing my virginity in a back room at The Fireside Bowl with a guy who also couldn't sing and fronted a band called Automat Sandwich. The band sucked, but he was a really nice guy who asked multiple times during our what-the-hell-am-I-doing sex if I was ok. I always thought that was sweet and while the relationship went nowhere, we stayed friends when he started another band and actually had some minor fame.If I ever start another band, which I won't, I might call it "Minor Fame Adjacent," since that's how my life has gone. Brushes with minor celebrities while living in obscurity. Dave gave up on the band and went to college for business. I actually held on to the lead singer role until grunge came along and killed punk, and I graduated from high school and decided I needed a real job. That's how they get you to give up, how they convince you to hang up your torn fishnets and do something respectable. They ask you how you'll pay your bills and what kind of life you think you'll have sweating your makeup off every night for an audience of twenty. So I followed Dave to college and majored in writing. Because, yeah, that was a more reliable path (I obviously had learned nothing from my absentee father.)

07 Journaling Ideas
item.description: What am I hungry for?What do I long for?What do I crave?What do I desire?Seek and face our truths. Listen to our souls. Let live what must live. Let die what must die. Develop intuition to know what we need and desire. Be brave enough to head that call.Shadow Work Journal Prompts for exploring the Female ShadowIn what ways do I deny or suppress my own needs, desires, or emotions to maintain peace or seek validation?Are there any female role models, past or present, that I feel negatively about-why is this?What are some societal messages that I have internalized about what it means to be a woman? How do these messages affect my sense of self and identity?What are some ways that I may have internalized misogyny or sexism? How can I challenge and reframe these beliefs to support my own empowerment and the empowerment of other women?What are some ways that I may have suppressed or denied my own feminine energy or power? How can I reclaim and integrate this?How have I internalized shame or guilt around my sexuality? How can I release these feelings and embrace my sexuality as natural and healthy aspect of my being?Have I internalized the belief that I must always be nurturing and selfless, at the expense of my own needs and desires? How can I learn to prioritize my own needs and desires (while still being compassionate and nurturing toward others)?How do I conform to societal beauty standards? Does this feel authentic? If not, how can I embrace my own unique beauty and reject unrealistic beauty standards?Thinking about a time I was polite and accommodating in a situation where I felt uncomfortable or unsafe - how could I have set healthy boundaries, and asserted my own needs?How have I internalized the belief that I must always be competitive and aggressive in order to succeed? How can I embrace my own unique strengths and collaborate with others in a way that supports mutual success?What are some ways that I can celebrate and honor my own femininity and the femininity of other women while rejecting harmful stereotypes and societal expectations?Thinking about a time I felt jealous around another woman, what triggered this?Reflecting on my relationship with my mother or other feminine figures, identify any areas of pain, resentment, or confusion.

item.description: the remains of King Richard III, found under a parking lot the way rain drips from autumn I’ve left secrets for you, hanging in the fog why don’t you come closer and I’ll tell you more butterfly wings into dragon’s breath barefoot days with the flowers calling the colors home it's not that midnight suddenly holds peace in it's empty hands Pour me a few fingers of 80 truth the season is the reason for the trauma (I had a dream and this was a line in a song in the dream. I think it would make the perfect emo Christmas song lol) we all stay up too late , we all whisper I’m sorry to the night you never listen to the lyrics, only hear the tune a smile sits snug in the hollow of a collarbone she folds herself into herself into herself into thirds and fourths when time hovers like glass shards before the blood hummingbird heart Devil's advocate on my shoulder ‘til then I’ll keep company with the rain. I think I owe some money to September for some past due I no longer remember strip mall church What if I die And there's no one to write a poem To the fact that I lived No one to eulogize the way my laugh made them smile No one to remember that I always needed a book to read and a backup book just in case That I enjoyed a glass of plum wine At the restaurant with the koi fish And the tall thin sushi master everything was quiet in the loudest possible way Those are the times that haunt me The times I was oblivious to the Universe whispering, "not today." Do people still write their names in the front of books Learning to hold delicate things Poetry was born from the saliva of the gods In between coffee drip And radio static the rain names me melancholy my dreams name me blue the crushed robin's egg under the tree, a reminder of one less song blowing through another summer without you Sinkhole with a forest inside love no longer asks to sit with me quietly under apple trees in June. No longer asks me to carve names into old wood. Half light firefly Does she feel more soft When the moon is a curve of a hip bone Rather than a round belly There is nothing but the hand On her knee Under the stain of a red stop light What life consumed by war reduced to smoke reduced to Hello my name is resting upon every chest as though we are labeled by what we can't control as if we are defined by the places we have been led Psychic antique shop Linger at the door as we say goodbye Let me tell you where I've been... I lived at the top of the world Here we all weep significant figures thistle and bone I am a summer birthday/a June wildflower Poem about dentist How are you today tell me if you feel any pain I had a dream that I couldn't throw you a party because there were too many guns and clutter from too much consumption. This morning I spoke to a random god told her why I could not kneel explained to her why narcisissum is in the DSM - V Everyone who came Became everyone who left Until no one remained Who remembered my name And the sky spanned on And the the sea - The sea is a meticulous mandolin. the moon - The moon is a prehistoric lemon drop. death - Death is a flaccid mannequin. NASA, describing it in the most melancholy way possible, says, “Mostly, a deep silence prevails.” NASA on the sounds recorded by the Mars river My worth has absolutely nothing to do with anyone else. With their opinions of me, their ideas about life, the way they do things, their opinions about how I do things, their beliefs about who I am, their opinions about what I should be doing, about what is right and wrong. My worth has absolutely nothing to do with any of that. It doesn't concern me. He was an old man he was a young man he was the man who wasn't there Capitalism will not pay for wisdom age is a deficit of profit the prophet can not be compensated when time hangs like glass shards after the break is there enough time for a poem to form or only for a dream to die by word or surrender we add pieces of ourselves the city doesn't know there is silence waiting butterfly ghost wings for this we make ourselves bleed pour me a few fingers of 80 truth butterflies drink the tears of turtles pick out a tune on a possibility heartwood blood queen a field of cosmos walk in cemeteries leaving notes of "I'll see you soon" five buttons are all that remain you left bruises and I said I was sorry for the way I stung your palm. Two Skateboards side by side Two hearts holding hands Don’t let me fall I have my words to string together, my thoughts to sort. Pencils to take into the woods, logs to sit upon, and poems to pull from the wind. I am a believer in the fact that things don't have to be overly sweet to kill you Does she let you tie her in knots He could always claim truthfully that there had never been blood on his own hands It's in these spaces where I am selfish Waiting Wednesdays She built a pedestal from the hard marble of self loathing, set him upon it and cried when he shattered it with absent fists and ghosted good byes. Do you talk to yourself sometimes? that little fat prehistoric statue sun spots 5 things (see, smell, hear, touch, taste) Fill a tent with the dead I walked on crushed flower petals/And tried to forget your name my fantasies wield knives Boys on bikes waving at trains Dreaming of the northern lights Gas station in lomira Things shaped like hearts Leaves Rocks How this would represent love the punks were poets first to edge the black skirt of night composed me into measures, and somehow echoed in every heavy downbeat exactly the sound of my heart beat It’s a tidal pull, this longing for open water. but the ocean will wait. She’s patient and understands your desire for the taste of salty skin. a deep blackbird night. When a bit of lightning is no replacement for the mercy of a white dove daybreak. There are questions I save for the darkness, but the darkness never replies. It only sits silently on my chest and steals my breath. this strange emptiness feels like the last day of summer like the first day of school when 15 was old I love you and goodbye both come at the end of something. In the days before our stomachs became full of worry stones - life tumbled smooth, but not without imperfection. wool gathered memory lavender laughter sage advice we all stay up too late we all whisper I’m sorry to the night please don't read what the night reveals a thin soul so see through that you can see through I’m tripping spring snowmelt Appropriating joy I am from sea foam sea shells/mother of pearl inlay Incised meanders Ephemeral streams Women gave birth to all the men who hate us. -- A woman gave birth to every woman hating man. item.title: 05 Fiction Ideas
item.description: Sometimes I silently beg for people to show me my worth - I think I must have been a bad person in another life. A villain in another incarnation. I must have taken all the praise for myself and never uttered a kind word. I must have neglected my children, pushed away love, and sneered at friendship. I must have held kindness like a precious stone, gripped in clenched hands, all for myself and not for sharing. I must have left so many people out in the cold - unseen, unheard, and uncared for. I think I must have been a very bad person in another life. Because no matter how much I give in this one, I am destined to remain on the outside. An empty cup. A lonely night. A restless ghost. Unseen, unheard, and uncared for. Kindness extended. Always. Hype given. Always. Cup filled. Always. { even as I am drained } fictionalized journaling people in heaven watching themselves be slowly forgotten on Earth female hero in midlife - everyone deserves to see themselves as the hero.

item.title: 04 Essay Ideas

write little imagery heavy vignettes like this: Who are we writing for Are we writing with that voice in our heads telling us it's terrible How you come back from a long break How doing everything the same way, following rules and “how-tos” is turning art and thinking into one voice Holding on to old words/writing/ideas Proper poetic form Letting go of grudges/conflict/people who you don't like or don't like you Maybe it's just not for me What we're missing out on with caller ID and never getting wrong numbers. item.title: Tiny Musings
item.description: 📌 every day in this country there is another wound on our hearts undated I have never done any drug harder than alcohol, but I'm telling ya, when I'm an old woman I'm going to smoke a little weed and just not give a shit what other people are doing with their own damn lives. undated (sometime in 2024?) Don't let men steal your time from creating and writing and being and rising and reaching every bit of potential you have. Goddamn, I am so fucking intelligent. I am so fucking capable. Why did I give away my power so easily? (Thoughts while reading The Bell Jar) October 10, 2024 I drink coffee like it would kill me to remember your promises. 2024 Genocide, war, equality, rights - these things get labeled "political" when they are literally the things that impact the very life of other people or ourselves. Politics is what decides if we live freely or under fascism. Whether we have health care or not. It decides if minorities are protected or lynched. Whether bombs are dropped on children or if we agree that all life is valuable. "Politics" is our voice against evil. Every human, no matter their profession or passion, has a right to that voice and should be free to use it as loudly as they are called to do. December 30, 2023 What if all the humans left the internet, except for bill paying and personal things? What if we let the AI generated content and all of the ads get likes and traffic from the porn bots. Let the algorithms feed themselves on machine made content only consumed by other machines? Would the internet continue on while humans read real books by real people and talked to each other again? We are headed to a place where AI is going to get so good at content creation and deepfakes that we are at risk of getting sucked into an attention dominating black hole, but where right now it's human made content pulling us in, soon it will all be machine made to cater to our very specific tastes. Machines entertaining us with machine made content while ads scroll by. Who are the people that really want that future?? The ones set to make the most money from it. At any cost. December 29, 2023 The Secret to Life: pay attention love what you love share what you love create something share that repeat enthusiastically July 17, 2023 We are the latest of a people once new, who've forgotten most of what we once knew. > July 16, 2023 Maybe, for whatever reason, unknown to you now, you were born a writer. You were born to string words together. And maybe, for some unknown reason, you are supposed to string those words together in obscurity. It’s your birthright. It has always felt like your birthright. Accept it. Hold it as you would any fragile gift, and use it without fear. Undated I want to lighten the world, to erase the creeping darkness. I want to create a space of beauty. A space that promotes what I love, rather than highlights what I hate. If we focused solely on what feeds our souls, could we not rid the world of what eats at them? February 28, 2021 Names for my imaginary band: pop: The Fuzzy Peppermints indie: Rustic Church punk: Graphic Blandishment all girl pop punk: Yeah Nadia Can a society that measures time by wars achieve peace? April 1, 2017 Paying the bill at dinner last night: Husband: Do you have any ones? Me: Go fish. February 18, 2017 If I were a number, I’d be a non-terminating decimal. January 30, 2017 Everyone deserves someone who looks at them the way Barack Obama looks at Michelle! January 10, 2017 Go outside spontaneously when it’s freezing and you will become a whim-sicle. December 12, 2016 Story of my life - Instead of shining brightly, I dim my glow for the approval of mediocre lovers. November 29, 2016 My mind can't think in poetry when the pockets of silence are shallow. September 6, 2016 Tiny sunburn on my legs makes me think I like the moonlight so much more August 2, 2016 Dog, plane, lawnmower, car, garbage truck, ambulance - where is the silence? June 30, 2016 Doesn’t saying “color scheme” make it seem like the colors are all plotting a scam of some kind? June 15, 2016 Undated: I think it says a lot about how my New Year's resolutions are going that I'm just thinking of waiting until tomorrow and turning them into Lunar New Year's resolutions. Let a little more life into your days, so that when you are at the end of that life, you may draw upon the well of experience and drink from memory. You have the right to keep your secrets. To secretly dream, to secretly love, to secretly hate. They, and your body, are the only things you own outright. I feel like the older I get the more I want to live and speak authentically. I don't want to censor myself or be someone I'm not anymore. If a cat eats a moth, is it like when we eat a powdered donut? If only I could pursue my current goals with the tenacity of 12 year old me calling the radio station over and over for a solid week trying to win Huey Lewis and the News tickets. I am the only person on a planet of almost 8 billion who just saw a chipmunk taking a bath on my back patio. For all the terrible things happening all at once, there are also so many small astonishments out there if only we take the time to really look. Do not let age put out your fire. Do not silence yourself. Do not become cold. Do not become hard. Stay soft, stay curious, stay playful. Become fierce with the passing years. The world is full of people who have no idea how technology works. Who have no idea how to research basic information. They are electing other people like them who have no idea how anything works. And the rest of us are being held hostage by their ignorance and thirst for power. It's terrifying. Social Media has created a world where we strive to be right instead of kind. We share with strangers things we are too afraid to share with friends. We’re living in a sandcastle, pretending the tide will never come. It helps to remember that no one else knows what the fuck they are doing either. Mirror, mirror on the wall - you’re so focused on looks, you judgmental jerk. Society keeps you caged with the illusion of freedom. I feel like I'm at the age where I need to start asking myself just what kind of old lady I want to be. Have you ever been nurtured? Really. Have you? Reconnecting with people you haven't talked to since high school is like the awkward reunion episode of a long cancelled TV show. Most things exist between the extremes. What could be waiting for you to arrive? I wonder if clouds ever look down on us and say "Hey, look! That one is shaped like an idiot." I sat for an hour in a quiet house of bird song and wind, mom mode off. Reading of injustice and the way hearts and minds reroute and heal from destruction. Outraged at the lack of empathic response in humans who house a brain wired for connection.

item.title: Passing Thoughts
item.description: (spring) Spring fell in three days of relentless rain. Soaking the first sprouts and turning yards to fresh mud. While we waited for the leaves, the birds filled the trees instead, with long awaited song. Soon the colors will wake from their long sleep, and we will believe that hope is what made it all bloom once more. (crone) I had a revelation last night about how I've gone through life never feeling good enough because I have based my worth on whether or not I'd be seen as attractive to a man. Last night I was like, fuck this. I want to be a wise old crone with waves of grey hair and mala beads wrapped around the skin of my crepe paper arms. I want to welcome people to come sit and talk and be comforted. To perhaps spill some wise words. I never again want to give a fuck if someone finds me attractive. What a shallow way to think about men as well. (holiday eats) You can make all of these delicious Christmas/holiday foods anytime of year. Just sayin'. Pumpkin pie on the 4th of July. Christmas cookies for Easter. Cranberry sauce (as long as you freeze some berries) on a random day in May. There is no need to feel pressured to make green bean casserole or homemade rolls only in December. The realization that you can enjoy these things at any time of year takes some of the pressure off having to make all of the things at a time of year when your body may be craving rest. It allows you to nourish your body with what it is actually craving instead of stuffing it full of foods you believe only come once a year. (writing) Sitting down to a blank page is like going to work in your underwear. People may like what they see, or they’ll laugh or tell you where to buy a better fitting bra. When we write, especially when we share, we open ourselves to the harsh reality of standing in a room, exposed. (artist's statement) Kelli tells poetic stories that examine the connection between nature and human nature. Stories of love, rebirth, and longing. Stories of secrets hidden away in seashells and cottages of madness. Not content to limit herself, she rambles through themes and styles with the quiet voice of a conversation at midnight. She hopes her poems of solitude can give the reader a place to rest, away from the noise and chaos of the world. (aesthetic) I wish I could invite you into an aesthetic. We could sit in a white room on a blush couch free of crumbs and random letters. Drink sweet tea in matching cups, served on a wooden tray without stains of other lives. A perfectly neutral space where you could rest your feet on a plush pouf, instead of regrets. There would be order & the perfect border of white space hiding closets full of autobiographies & sharp knives. I could invite you into an aesthetic lie, but really, where’s the fun in that? (a happiness collection) I once bought a silly, realistic-looking, plastic rooster. I thought it would be funny to set it by the front door of our new house. As people visited, they obviously noticed the rooster. And thought that it meant I had a love of roosters. Pretty soon I was getting roosters for gifts. Rooster prints, rooster doorstops, ceramic roosters. Before I knew it I had a whole collection of roosters. The problem was, it really wasn’t my thing. I didn’t have any great love for roosters. Sometimes life can be like that. It starts throwing things at you that you really don’t want. You find yourself spending your days doing things you don’t enjoy. Your life becomes a collection of things you didn’t choose. Don’t live a life with a bunch of roosters you don’t want. Clear out all of the things that don’t bring you joy and live a life that makes you happy. In 2023 let's choose to live. Let's choose fun over fear. Let's create for ourselves rather than for likes. Let's make terrible art. Let's laugh at stupid shit. Let's love and be open to others without the fear of rejection. Let's choose people who go out of their way to show us they care over the assholes who treat us like burdens. Let's make the world a better place. Let's promote what we love rather than giving space to what we hate. Let's look at each other with compassion. Let's be vulnerable. Let's be soft. Let's realize that each person is inherently worthy of our love. Let's realize that we are the people inherently worthy of love. Let's create a circle of acceptance. I love you all. I hope you carry that love and just a dash of hope into 2023. Happy New Year! (4 Am) - It's almost 4am. 4am is the hour when we admit all of the feelings we have that we tell ourselves we shouldn't All of the truths we swallow down when the sun is up and everything seems like it will work out 4am tells us were fools to believe any of it 4am makes us face ourselves in the darkness like Luke facing himself in that cave on Dagobah. We realize we are really Darth Vader even though we thought we were a Jedi at heart. 4am is the hour of facing our dark side and realizing it's who we really are. 8/7/22 (fuck off) To the "agree to disagree" crowd I am respectful of your beliefs and your way of life until those beliefs impact others.Human rights are not up for debate. Whether they be reproductive rights, or Igbq rights, or equal rights for people of color or women, these things are not up for debate and I will not agree to disagree with you on any one of them. If you try to shove your beliefs into my vagina and fuck me over with them, I will not "agree to disagree." And don't come at me with your mask and vaccine mandate false equivalency arguments. My unplanned pregnancy does not affect you. Your covid breath affects me. Just so we're clear on this. (gendered sports) I have a solution for the people who are so pressed about trans women in sports. If it's a sport like swimming or running where people are timed, stop dividing people by gender and instead make time categories regardless of gender. Your average time in whatever race is however many seconds? You're in whatever category for that time. Gender doesn't have to come into it. Only speed. There. I solved that problem. Stay tuned for more of my very wise solutions to invented problems. (on taking advice) Read all the booklists you want. Take all the suggestions, keep up to date on what's on the bestseller lists - but in the end, leave room for what you enjoy. If a book isn't speaking to you, no matter how well reviewed, how often suggested, then choose to put it down without finishing it. There are not enough years in a life to read all of the books and if you spend too many of them reading what's on other people's lists, you may never be able to compile your own. I would say a similar thing about any kind of list or advice. Read all of it you want, take what you need, but in the end you know yourself and what will work for you best. Reading a writer's list of what worked to get them writing may be a great place to start, but in the end only you know what works for you. Maybe they woke at dawn to write 100 pages before lunch. Maybe you sit down after lunch and write 20 pages. So, you decide to start waking at dawn, only you're not a morning person so you're falling asleep and not writing anything at all. Listen to your mind and body. It knows what works for you. Someone who has never even heard of you can't tell you how to work or play. (media consumption) How many corporate slogans, jingles, live rent free in your head? How much are you affected by the ads you see without even realizing? How much do we allow advertising and corporations to decide the things that bond is together as a society? TV shows we watch, movies we've seen, songs chosen for us to hear on the radio, jingles and ads that are the glue of generations. Products we all remember from the specific point in history that was our childhood shared with our cohorts. How much does this shape our collective experience? How are we united by things we never chose? How are we divided by them? How much have I been altered by the media I consumed as a child/teenager? All the books, movies, TV shows, and love songs? How much of my dialogue was written in a script in the 80s? Are my expectations of relationships based in a scripted, unrealistic ideal?
